content.text: Bash touch Command - Change File Timestamps
Using the touch Command
The touch command is used to change file timestamps or create an empty file if it doesn't exist.
content.html: The touch command is used to change file timestamps or create an empty file if it doesn't exist.

content.text: It's often used to create placeholder files or update timestamps for build systems.
content.html: It's often used to create placeholder files or update timestamps for build systems.

content.text: Basic Usage
To update the access and modification times of a file, use touch filename :
content.html: To update the access and modification times of a file, use touch filename:

content.code_html: touch file.txt

content.text: Options
The touch command has options to change how it works:
content.html: The touch command has options to change how it works:

content.text: -a Option: Change Access Time
The -a option lets you update the access time of a file.
content.html: The -a option lets you update the access time of a file.

content.code_html: touch -a file.txt

content.text: -m Option: Change Modification Time
The -m option lets you update only the modification time of a file.
content.html: The -m option lets you update only the modification time of a file.

content.code:
ls
-l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 06:24 my_file.txt

touch
-m my_file.txt

ls
-l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 08:25 my_file.txt
content.code_html:
ls -l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 06:24 my_file.txt
touch -m my_file.txt
ls -l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 08:25 my_file.txt

content.text: -t Option: Set Specific Timestamp
The -t option allows you to set the timestamp to a specific time.
content.html: The -t option allows you to set the timestamp to a specific time.

content.code:
ls
-l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 06:24 my_file.txt

touch
-t
202501010000
my_file.txt

ls
-l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Jan  1 00:00 my_file.txt
content.code_html:
ls -l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Apr  9 06:24 my_file.txt
touch -t 202501010000 my_file.txt
ls -l
-rw-r--r-- 1 user 197609 208 Jan  1 00:00 my_file.txt

content.text: -c Option: Do Not Create Files
The -c option tells touch not to create any files if they do not exist.
content.html: The -c option tells touch not to create any files if they do not exist.

content.text: This is useful when you want to update timestamps without accidentally creating new files.
content.html: This is useful when you want to update timestamps without accidentally creating new files.

content.code_html: touch -c non_existent_file.txt

content.text: Using touch with Wildcards
Wildcards allow you to update timestamps on multiple files at once.
content.html: Wildcards allow you to update timestamps on multiple files at once.

content.text: For example, touch *.txt will update the timestamps of all text files in the directory.
content.html: For example, touch *.txt will update the timestamps of all text files in the directory.

content.code_html: touch *.txt
